content: Maya Angelou's influence can be seen across a wide range of writers, artists, and activists. Notable figures influenced by Angelou include the author Toni Morrison, who cited Angelou as a significant influence on her own writing, as well as Oprah Winfrey and the musician Alicia Keys, who have both spoken about how Angelou's work has inspired and empowered them. Many young people have also been inspired by Angelou's work, and her poetry and memoir continue to be taught in schools and colleges around the world. Some writers who have been influenced by Angelou's work and activism include Elizabeth Alexander, Claudia Rankine, Ta-Nehisi Coates, and many others.
